title: MSFT_collision_primitives glTF extension
description: Parameters describing a node's physics collision geometry.

anyOf.description: A sphere with a specified radius, centered at the origin in local space.
An axis-aligned box with a size per-axis, centered at the origin in local space

A capsule shape, centered at the origin in local space, equivalent to the convex hull of two spheres of radius `radius` located along the Y axis (in local space) at a distance `height` from each other. i.e., the sphere centers are located at (0, ±height/2, 0)

A cylinder shape, centered at the origin in local space, equivalent to the convex hull of two circles in the X/Z plane of radius `radius` located along the Y axis (in local space) at a distance `height` from each other. i.e., the circle centers are located at (0, ±height/2, 0)
A shape defined as the convex hull of a referenced `mesh` (which itself need not be convex) in local space.
An infinitely thin surface defined by the triangles in the referenced `mesh` in local space.

oneOf.description: A set of parameter values that are used to define a sphere collider.
A set of parameter values that are used to define a box collider.
A set of parameter values that are used to define a capsule collider.
A set of parameter values that are used to define a cylinder collider.
A set of parameter values that are used to define a convex collider.
A set of parameter values that are used to define a mesh collider.
